resources.string: Map and Manage what Drives your Child\'s Interests.

A smart parenting app to help you map what drives your child\'s interest while managing their life better on-the-go. It\â€™s easy, intuitive and insightful. You can now stay up-to-date with your child\'s ever evolving interests with our Interest Mapping Reports and ensure you make smarter more interest focused choices.
What would you like to view?
You will soon be able to connect with others parents in your community.
You will soon be able to view recommended activities for your children based on their interest reports and network activities.

• Insights are driven by the data received from you and your children.

• Data Quality Badge is a ranking that indicates the quality of the data based on consistency and frequency of the activity rating data received from children.

• The higher the data quality badge, the more realistic and reliable the Insights will be.

• Add more activities and Encourage your children to rate regularly to improve the report rank.

• Interest Drivers are the factors that stimulate children when they do various activities.

• Children are stimulated (or not) by these factors across different levels of delight.

• In this section of Insights, you can view Interest Drivers that exhilarate your child, those that amuse them and those they find unexciting.

• You can also view Interest Drivers that are non-influencing or those your child has never explored.

• Activity Rating reflect a list of top 10 activities based on their activity rating over a period of 30 days.

• Know how consistently (or not) this activity makes your child happy.

• Children earn PiNWi points everyday when they rate activities.

• Points are awarded to keep children interested in the rating process.

• These points can be used in future to get gifts and games.

• encourage authenticity of rating data, we encourage rating everyday.

• However, rating can be done for up to 7 days in the past.

• Points will be lost for days the activities were not rated.

• Interest Patterns throw insight into a childâ€™s interest framework analyzed over a defined period of time.

• Interest Patterns indicate Interest Drivers that define childrenâ€™s interest independent of their age and the activities they do.

• In this section, know Interest Drivers that are Long Held, New Found or are busy playing See-Saw with your child.
You have no parent connection in your network.

string-array.name: guidestepdetails
string-array.item: Hi! Start by adding all subjects your child \n does at school.
Next, add all after-school activities your \n child is enrolled in
Include free time & leisure activities as well like Board Games or Online Games. This is important!
Set all school holidays and other planned \n holidays so we know the off days.
Use the calendar to keep tab on all \n schedules
Most importantly, make your children rate all these activities every evening using their login.

resources.string: We thought you might ask \n yourself this.

When you schedule activities your children 
 do and your children rate them everyday, we 
 gather meaningful data. We use this data to 
 give you reliable, realistic and real-time 
 insights that can help you stay focused on your childâ€™s interests. Remember interests evolve with time and exposure. So keep the activities updated and the ratings consistent.
This is one time purchase and gives you access to all the Pinwi Features.
This will generate an Instant Interest Report for your child. You need to do this together with your child.\n Select a child to continue.

string-array.name: get_started_features
string-array.item: Pinwi helps you map what drives your child\'s interests while managing their life better on-the-go. It\'s easy, intuitive and insightful. You can now stay up-to-date with your child\'s ever evolving interests and ensure you make smarter more interest focused choices.

Children\'s interests are driven by what makes them happy. The easiest way to know what makes children happy is to listen to them. Pinwi helps you do this in three unique ways â€“rating activities, creating wish lists and posting about things they love to do.

Why children get bored of activities so quickly; or why what they once loved doesn\'t excite them anymore? Psychologists say, unlike aptitude and inherent skills, interests are ever-evolving. For a more well rounded development its important for children balance both aptitude and interests.

Children who love quizzes and trivia are mostly driven by a hunger to seek knowledge, as are children who enjoy going to museums. Both reflect an interest that involves feeding a curious mind to learn more about the world, its people, their ideas, views and experiences.

Children who enjoy playing strategy games like chess, checkers or monopoly are likely to enjoy subjects like Science, Computers, and Astronomy. Just like the subjects, strategy games are also driven by logical thinking and involve reasoning and problem solving.

That interest in Fine Arts is just about the ability to express creatively. Our research says â€“ children interested in activities such as painting, sketching and other art forms are driven by a stronger visual sense than a desire for creative expression.
Tap to Read Our Blog for Fun Facts,\n Information & more.

string-array.name: insights_slider_features
string-array.item: Why children get bored of activities so quickly; or why what they once loved doesn\'t excite them anymore? Psychologists say, unlike aptitude and inherent skills, interests are ever-evolving. For a more well rounded development its important for children balance both aptitude and interests.

Children who love quizzes and trivia are mostly driven by a hunger to seek knowledge, as are children who enjoy going to museums. Both reflect an interest that involves feeding a curious mind to learn more about the world, its people, their ideas, views and experiences.

Children who enjoy playing strategy games like chess, checkers or monopoly are likely to enjoy subjects like Science, Computers, and Astronomy. Just like the subjects, strategy games are also driven by logical thinking and involve reasoning and problem solving.

That interest in Fine Arts is just about the ability to express creatively. Our research says â€“ children interested in activities such as painting, sketching and other art forms are driven by a stronger visual sense than a desire for creative expression.
